revised_title: Observations of Carneous Fibers, Brain Structure, and Blood Vessels
tldr: In this letter, Mr. Leewenhoeck describes his observations of the carneous fibers of muscles and the cortical and medullar parts of the brain. He uses a microscope to study the structure and composition of these tissues, discovering that they consist of small globular particles. He also examines the blood vessels in the brain and finds them to be extremely fine and numerous, which he believes play a crucial role in the brain's function.
